adqlParser
Class SaadaDBConsistency

java.lang.Object
  adqlParser.parser.DBConsistency
      adqlParser.SaadaDBConsistency

public class SaadaDBConsistency
extends DBConsistency

Checks whether each reference to the database generated by Saada is correct (columns and tables existence) and sets the meta data of each selected column.

Version:
06/2010
Author:
Grégory Mantelet (CDS)
See Also:
DBConsistency

getClassName

public static final java.lang.String getClassName(java.lang.String className)

Gets the former class name if the specified class exists.

Note:
The function CacheMeta.classExists(String) checks also the existence of the given class but take care of the case of the given class name. However getClassName(String) checks the existence of the given class whatever the case of the given name and returns the class name (with its "true" case) found in the cache.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class whose the existence must be check.
Returns:
null if the specified class doesn't exist, the former class name otherwise.
See Also:
CacheMeta.getClass_names()

getCollectionName

public static final java.lang.String getCollectionName(java.lang.String collName)

Gets the former collection name if the specified collection exists.

Note:
The function CacheMeta.collectionExists(String) checks also the existence of the given collection but take care of the case of the given collection name. However getCollectionName(String) checks the existence of the given collection whatever the case of the given name and returns the collection name (with its "true" case) found in the cache.

Parameters:
collName - The name of the collection whose the existence must be check.
Returns:
null if the specified collection doesn't exist, the former collection name otherwise.
See Also:
CacheMeta.getCollection_names()

queryVerif

public boolean queryVerif(ADQLQuery q)
                   throws ParseException
(PSEUDO MERGER of SAADA)
For each class found in the FROM list, this function adds its corresponding collection (if it's not already done) with the appropriate join on the field oidsaada. All references to columns of class or of collection are updated if necessary (that is to say if there is ambiguity since the last modifications).

Overrides:
queryVerif in class DBConsistency
Parameters:
q - The query to check.
Returns:
true if the query has passed successfully all the last modifications, false otherwise.
Throws:
ParseException - If there is some error !
See Also:
classifyImpliedColumns(Vector, Vector, HashMap, HashMap), lookForJoin(Iterator, HashMap, HashMap, HashMap), checkUnknownColumns(HashMap), classifyMixedColumns(Vector, HashMap, HashMap, ADQLQuery), updateFromAndJoin(HashMap, HashMap, ADQLQuery), DBConsistency.queryVerif(adqlParser.query.ADQLQuery)

classifyImpliedColumns

private void classifyImpliedColumns(java.util.Vector<ADQLObject> impliedColumns,
                                    java.util.Vector<ADQLColumn> mixedCols,
                                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<ADQLColumn>> mapKnownCols,
                                    java.util.HashMap<ADQLColumn,java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> mapUnknownCols)
                             throws ParseException
Classifies the given columns in three categories:
  • mixed (can be found either in class or collection)
  • known (the column exists in one of the selected tables)
  • unknown (all other columns; for instance, columns of the collection, if only the class table is in the FROM).

Parameters:
impliedColumns - The list of columns to classify.
mixedCols - The list of mixed columns. UPDATED in this method.
mapKnownCols - The list of known columns. UPDATED in this method.
mapUnknownCols - The list of unknown columns. UPDATED in this method.
Throws:
ParseException - If one column can be in more than one table.
See Also:
queryVerif(ADQLQuery)

lookForJoin

private int lookForJoin(java.util.Iterator<ADQLTable> itTables,
                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<ADQLColumn>> mapKnownCols,
                        java.util.HashMap<ADQLColumn,java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> mapUnknownCols,
                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,SaadaDBConsistency.JoinIndication> joinIndications)
                 throws ParseException
Determines, for each table selected in the clause FROM (joined tables included), whether it is used in the query and whether a join to its collection is needed.

Parameters:
itTables - Iterator on the list of tables selected in the clause FROM of a query.
mapKnownCols - The list of all known columns. UPDATED in this method.
mapUnknownCols - The list of all unknown columns.
joinIndications - All join indications (tells whether a join between a class and collection is needed and whether they are used in the query). UPDATED in this method.
Returns:
The number of tables which must be REALLY used in the query.
Throws:
ParseException - NONE
See Also:
queryVerif(ADQLQuery)

checkUnknownColumns

private void checkUnknownColumns(java.util.HashMap<ADQLColumn,java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> mapUnknownCols)
                          throws ParseException
Ensures that all columns of the unknown columns list are now known.

Parameters:
mapUnknownCols - The list of all unknown columns.
Throws:
ParseException - If a column has not been classify in a class or a collection or if a column is in more than one table and doesn't specify the table to use.
See Also:
queryVerif(ADQLQuery)

classifyMixedColumns

private void classifyMixedColumns(java.util.Vector<ADQLColumn> mixedCols,
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<ADQLColumn>> mapKnownCols,
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,SaadaDBConsistency.JoinIndication> joinIndications,
                                  ADQLQuery q)
                           throws ParseException
In function of the joins to make, this method classify all the mixed columns.

Parameters:
mixedCols - The mixed columns to classify.
mapKnownCols - The list of all known columns.
joinIndications - All join indications.
q - The ADQL query.
Throws:
ParseException - If a column can't be classify in a class or a collection or if a column is in more than one table and doesn't specify the table to use.
See Also:
queryVerif(ADQLQuery)

updateFromAndJoin

private void updateFromAndJoin(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,SaadaDBConsistency.JoinIndication> joinIndications,
                               java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<ADQLColumn>> mapKnownCols,
                               ADQLQuery q)
                        throws ParseException
Update the query in a function of each join indication:
  • Class is used but not collection: nothing to do !
  • Class and collection are used:
    • 1. add the table corresponding to the collection into the clause FROM.
    • 2. add the join condition between the class and the collection.
    • 3. update all columns classified into the class and those of the collection.
  • Collection is used but not class: change the name of the table (which was the name of the class) into the name of the collection (the table alias is not change).
  • Neither the class or the collection are used: nothing done, but a warning message could be printed and/or the table could be removed from the query.

Parameters:
joinIndications - All join indications.
mapKnownCols - The list of known columns.
q - The query to update.
Throws:
ParseException - NONE
See Also:
queryVerif(ADQLQuery)
